content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Read the Start Researching in Norway Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Start Researching in Norway

  2. Read these articles to help you with your beginning Norwegian research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Tips for Beginning Research in Norway
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Background Info for Norwegian Research

  3. Tips: Read the Tips for Norwegian-American Researchers Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Tips for Norwegian-American Researchers

  4. Learn more about tracing your Norwegian roots in these articles.

    ☆ Norwegian Genealogy: How To Find Your Ancestors - 2011
    ☆ AR—Tracing Your Norwegian Roots - 2019

  5. Watch these videos for additional help with Norwegian research.

    ☆ RT—5 Easy Steps to Norwegian Genealogy—17:57 - 2021  
    • Personal sources
    • Public sources
    • Emigrant records
    • Emigrant records - 1900
    • Church records



    ☆ RT—A Deep Dive into Norwegian Research—20:23 - 2021  
    • Gothic handwriting
    • Norwegian census records
    • Church records
    • Some restrictions
    • Example church record
    • Probates
    • Names
    • Dialects



  6. Resources: Explore ☆Your Guide to Researching Norwegian Ancestors by Barb Snow.
  7. Explore a variety of records on the ☆NorwegianAncestry site.
  8. Find little-known sources for Norwegian research.

    ☆ RT—Help Your Norwegian Ancestors Come to Life Using Little-Used Sources - 2019
    ☆ Medieval Collection in the National Archives

Records
  1. Record Finder: Use the Norway Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Norway Record Finder

  2. Forebears.io: Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.
  3. Learn about Norway compiled genealogies in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Norway Compiled Genealogies

  4. Explore other ☆Norwegian compiled genealogies on the Internet.

1. FamilySearch: Learn about Norway archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Norway Archives and Libraries  
    • DigitalArkivet
    • Libraries in Norway
    • Archives in the U.S.

  2. Resources: Learn about online resources for Norway research, including the National Archives of Norway.

    ☆ LT—Online Resources for Researching Your Norwegian Ancestry

  3. Explore the Research tab of the ☆Norwegian American Genealogical Center website.
  4. Explore the ☆National Archive of Norway website.
  5. Explore the ☆Archives Portal Europe site. Click the Directories tab and select Norway.
  6. Explore other Norwegian archives and libraries on the Internet.
  7. Books We Own: Explore the ☆Books We Own site for books that can be checked out or researched for you by others.

choices.name: Explore Norway census records.

content.text:
1. Case Study: Follow this case study in Norwegian research.

    ☆ FS—Case History—3 pgs. - 2016

  2. Digitalarkivet: Learn how to find Norwegian ancestors using Digitalarkivet.

    ☆ FS—Digitalarkivet: Census Records - 2016

    3. Years

  5. Use Digitalarkivet to explore the 1885 Census.

choices.name: Explore Norwegian church records online.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for church records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.

content.text:
1. Learn how to use the Digitalarkivet site to find Norwegian moving records (of church-goers who moved between parishes).

    ☆ FS—Digitalarkivet: Church Records—4 pgs. - 2015

  2. Learn how to find online church records using resources at the University of Tromsø.

    ☆ FS—The Norwegian Historical Data Centre - Online Church Records—13:19 - 2021

  3. Learn about the Sjeleregister, an index of literacy and religion in Norway.

    ☆ FS—Sjeleregister (Index of Literacy and Religion) for Norway: What is a Sjeleregister?—13:19 - 2020

  4. Learn how to find a Sjeleregister in Norway.

    ☆ FS—Sjeleregister (Index of Literacy and Religion) for Norway: How to Find a Sjeleregister!—9:18 - 2020

  5. Learn how to find ministers and bishops in the Sjeleregister.

    ☆ FS—How to Find People in Norsk Slektshistorisk Forening (The Norwegian Genealogical Society): Find Ministers in the 1500s-1700s—11:55 - 2020
    ☆ FS—How to Find People in Norsk Slektshistorisk Forening (The Norwegian Genealogical Society): Find Bishops in the 1500s-1700s—3:17 - 2020

  6. Here's a case study for using the Sjeleregister.

    ☆ FS—Sjeleregister (Index of Literacy and Religion) for Norway: Case Study—18:09 - 2020

  7. Explore other ☆Norwegian church records on the Internet.

    ☆ European Emigration: Norway

  2. Learn about the history of Norwegian emigration.

    ☆ FS—Pre-1867 Emigration Records from Norway: History of Norwegian Emigration—3:49 - 2019

    ☆ FS—Pre-1867 Emigration Records from Norway: Emigration in the 1600 and 1700s—7:30 - 2019

choices.name: Explore Norwegian emigration resources.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for immigration resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Place of Origin: Learn how to find places of ancestor origin in Norwegian emigration records.

    ☆ FS—Exploring Norwegian Emigration Records: Finding Place of Origin—41:55 - 2019

  2. Digitalarkivet: Explore emigration resources from Norway on the DigitalArkivet site.
  3. Explore other ☆Norwegian Emigration resources on the Internet.
  4. Immigrant Ships: Explore the ☆Immigrant Ship site. Select a Volume, then choose Norway as the departure or arrival location.
  5. Emigration Center: Explore the ☆Norwegian Emigration Center online.
  6. Jewish: Explore the ☆Jewish Genealogy Encyclopedia for Jewish resources in Norway.

choices.name: Explore Norway passenger ship information on the Norway Heritage site.

content.text:
1. Access the ☆Norway Heritage site for passenger lists and information on emigrant ships.
  2. Read the articles about Norwegian emigration in the lower middle section of the page, beginning with "Articles for Newbies".
  3. Search for immigrant passengers using the top section of the page.
  4. Search for immigrants by specific ship information on the left side of the page.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about Norway maps and gazetteers.

choices.name: Learn about Norway maps and gazetteers.

content.text:
1. See an ☆interactive map for Norway counties.
  2. Learn about Norway maps in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Norway Maps

  3. Find ☆map resources for farms, communities, and more.

choices.name: Explore Norwegian maps.

content.text:
1. Explore a variety of topographical, historical, and interactive maps on the ☆Nordic Genealogical Society of Southern California website.
  2. Explore the ☆Norway Parishes website, an interactive web map for parishes.
  3. Explore the ☆David Rumsey collection of Norwegian maps.
  4. Explore the ☆Old Maps Online site for Norway maps.
  5. Explore other Norwegian maps on the Internet.
  6. Explore the ☆Atlas of Norway on the Wikipedia site.
  7. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Norway on the Wikipedia site.
  8. Explore a ☆directory of Norway cities, towns, and regions in the Falling Rain site.

choices.name: Explore Norway newspapers for ancestor research.

content.text:
1. Find links to ☆Norwegian newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Search Norwegian newspapers in the ☆onlinenewspapers.com site.
  3. Search Norwegian newspapers in the ☆world-newspapers.com site.
  4. Search Norwegian newspapers in the ☆ABYZ News Links site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Norwegian research.

content.text:
1. Explore links in the FamilySearch Wiki.
  2. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for Norway.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the FamilySearch page for Norwegian online record collections.
  4. Explore the Europe page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Norwegian research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Norwegian Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit another Norwegian Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆Northern Europe Genealogy Research Community on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Norway.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Norway research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆Norway-Heritage Forum for help on various research topics.
  2. Explore the ☆Norway research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Norway research.

choices.name: Learn about Norway genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about Norway genealogy societies in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Norway Societies

  2. Explore Norway genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.

  3. Learn more about DIS NORGE, the Genealogy Society of Norway.

    ☆ FS—Genealogy in Norway DIS NORGE—34:26

  4. Get help at a family history center in Norway.
